Heading: General/trade
Note: For a non-specialist adult audience. Consider also adding an ONIX Adult audience rating

Heading: Children/juvenile
Note: For a juvenile audience, not specifically for any educational purpose. An audience range should also be included

Heading: Young adult
Note: For a teenage audience, not specifically for any educational purpose. An audience range should also be included

Heading: Primary and secondary/elementary and high school
Note: Kindergarten, pre-school, primary/elementary or secondary/high school education. An audience range should also be included

Heading: College/higher education
Note: For tertiary education – universities and colleges of higher education

Heading: Professional and scholarly
Note: For an expert adult audience, including professional development and academic research

Heading: ELT/ESL
Note: Intended for use in teaching English as a second, non-native or additional language. Indication of the language level (eg CEFR) should be included where possible. An audience range should also be included if the product is (also) suitable for use in primary and secondary education

Heading: Adult education
Note: For an adult audience in a formal or semi-formal learning setting, eg vocational training, apprenticeships, or academic or recreational learning for adults

Heading: Second language teaching
Note: Intended for use in teaching second, non-native or additional languages, for example teaching German to Spanish speakers. Indication of the language level (eg CEFR) should be included where possible. An audience range should also be included if the product is (also) suitable for use in primary and secondary education. Prefer code 07 for products specific to teaching English
